clinical_study.brief_title: A New Method: the Third Space Robotic and Endoscopic Cooperative Surgery (TS-RECS)
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility of the Third Space Robotic and Endoscopic Cooperative Surgery(TS-RECS) for Treating Gastric Stromal Tumor

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital Xi'an Jiaotong University

brief_summary.textblock: The third space robotic and endoscopic cooperative surgery (TS-RECS) combines the endoscopic techniques and the merits of Da Vinci surgical robot, such as flexible and precise instruments, tremors filtering system and a 3-D surgical view. TS-RECS takes full advantage of the methodology of the third space, making it possible to dissect gastric GISTs (gastrointestinal stromal tumors) entirely without the damage of mucosal layer. Here, this study preliminarily assessed the feasibility, safety and effectivity of the novel hybrid operation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events included intraoperative adverse (full-thickness perforation, hemorrhage, injury of visceral organs and vessel, and anaesthesia complications), and postoperative adverse events (infectious complications, intra-abdominal /intraluminal bleeding, gastric stasis and leakage)

secondary_outcome.description: the en bloc resection was defined as complete tumor resection with negative surgical margin.

secondary_outcome.measure: the rate of intact mucosal layer
secondary_outcome.description: intact mucosal layer was defined as the tumor resection without full-thickness incision caused by operation
Operation time was defined from the time of docking to the time of trocar incision closure.
Blood loss was estimated through the analysis of the surgical and anaesthesiological reports.
time to oral diet to assess the postoperative course.
From the day of operation to the day of discharged, duration of postoperative hospital stay to assess the postoperative course.

intervention.intervention_name: the third space robotic and endoscopic cooperative surgery
intervention.description: This technique combines the endoscopic techniques and the merits of Da Vinci surgical robot, such as flexible and precise instruments, tremors filtering system and a 3-D surgical view, and take full advantage of the methodology of the third space to dissect gastric submucosal tumors.
